metadata.name: Birding
metadata.description:
The bombing of Dresden was an aerial bombing attack on the city of Dresden, the capital of the German state of Saxony, during World War II. The bombing and the resulting firestorm destroyed more than 1,600 acres (6.5 km2) of the city centre. An estimated 22,700 to 25,000 people were killed.
We have had so many aerial bombing attacks during WWs and every war on our globe! Let's imagine a world without any war. And Birding! instead of Bombing...!

ðŸ’¡ First piece - World War in collage
